description: Spanish adelantado, from Spanish adelantar (“to advance, to promote”).

entries.meaning: (historical) A governor of a province; a commander, in Spain and other Spanish-speaking countries.
examples: The grand master […] communicated it to the principal chiefs on the borders ; among others , to Don Pedro Henriquez , adelantado of Andalusia , Don Juan de Silva , count of Cifuentes , Don Alonso de Aguilar , and the marquis of Cadiz .
